newsitem.title: USA: Airborne Express cancels fuel surcharge.
newsitem.headline: Airborne Express cancels fuel surcharge.

text.p: Airborne Express, citing the recent downward trend in fuel prices, said it will drop its two percent fuel surcharge on most shipments effective July 1.
"With the recent drop in the cost of fuel, we can now eliminate the surcharge to our customers," Jerry Cameron, vice president, corporate accounts and pricing, said in a statement.
The surcharge had been implemented on Feb 17, long after more freight airlines imposed cargo fuel surcharges to cope with a sharp spike in fuel prices last winter.
Airborne is lifting its surcharge 2-3 months after most airlines lifted theirs.
The courier giant had been applying the surcharge to all domestic, Canadian and international express rates.
-- Reuters Air Cargo Newsroom Tel+44 171 542 7706 Fax+5017
